intro: Hieracium grandiparens, commonly known as the large-flowered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with upright stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium grandiparens is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes and seeds.
